skill.author: DoubleslashSE

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing markdown templates for technical analysis. All static findings are false positives: placeholder patterns in templates and ASCII diagrams were misidentified as shell commands. No code execution, network access, or credential handling occurs.

content.user_title: Analyze APIs, Data Models, and System Integrations
content.value_statement: Technical systems require thorough documentation to ensure reliability, security, and maintainability. This skill provides structured templates for analyzing and documenting APIs, data models, integrations, and security requirements with consistent formatting.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes REST, GraphQL, and message-based APIs with standardized documentation templates
Documents data models including entities, relationships, constraints, and indexes
Captures integration patterns with authentication, error handling, and SLA requirements
Evaluates security implementations including authentication, authorization, and data protection
Documents infrastructure components including compute, networking, and storage
limitations: Does not execute code or perform live testing against systems
Does not access external networks or APIs
Does not generate implementation code or configurations
Relies on existing code artifacts in the project for analysis

use_cases.title: Document Legacy API Endpoints
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive documentation for undocumented REST APIs by analyzing route definitions, controller classes, and existing code patterns.

use_cases.title: Create Data Model Reference Documentation
use_cases.description: Document database entities, their relationships, constraints, and indexes to serve as a reference for developers and data architects.

use_cases.title: Analyze Third-Party Integration Security
use_cases.description: Document authentication methods, data flows, and security requirements for external system integrations to identify gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze REST API Endpoints
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the REST API in this codebase. For each endpoint, document: HTTP method, path, purpose, authentication requirements, request parameters, response schemas, and error handling. Use the technical-analysis skill templates.

prompt_templates.title: Document Database Schema
prompt_templates.prompt: Examine the database models and document entities with their attributes, data types, relationships, constraints, and indexes. Include business rules where applicable.
prompt_templates.description: Examine the database models and document entities with their attributes, data types, relationships, constraints, and indexes. Include business rules where applicable.

prompt_templates.title: Map Integration Data Flows
prompt_templates.prompt: Trace data flows through external integrations. Document the source and destination systems, transformation logic, authentication methods, and error handling patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Review Security Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the authentication and authorization implementation. Document the access control model, roles, permissions, data protection measures, and compliance requirements.

output_examples.input: Analyze the user management API endpoints
output: **Response**: { content: User[], total: number, page: number }

output_examples.input: Document the customer entity data model
output: | email | string | Yes | Unique email address |

best_practices: Provide complete endpoint documentation including all parameters, headers, and possible response codes
Include business rules and validation logic in entity documentation
Document authentication flows and data protection measures explicitly
List dependencies and SLA requirements for integrations
anti_patterns: Leaving placeholders without filling in actual values from the codebase
Documenting only happy paths without error scenarios
Omitting authentication and authorization details from integration documentation

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: This skill uses Read, Grep, Glob, and LSP tools to analyze code and generate documentation from existing artifacts.

faq.question: Does this skill make network calls?
faq.answer: No. This skill only analyzes local code artifacts and generates markdown documentation templates.

faq.question: Can this skill analyze external APIs?
faq.answer: The skill can document API contracts from local code. To analyze external APIs, you must first import OpenAPI specs or similar artifacts locally.

faq.question: What file types can this skill analyze?
faq.answer: Any code files the LSP and Grep tools can parse, including source code, configuration files, and database schema definitions.

faq.question: Does this skill modify existing files?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates documentation content as output. It does not modify source code or existing documentation files.

faq.question: Can I customize the documentation templates?
faq.answer: The templates provide a starting point. You can modify the generated documentation to match your organization's standards.
